alert.note: Alert for Bath (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 25 at 9:50AM EST until February 25 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of less than an inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Portions of the Alleghany Highlands, southern Shenadoah Valley, and southeast West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Slick spots on bridges, overpasses and sidewalks possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light icing is possible in the trees at the higher elevations. Highway 39 which crosses Warm Springs mountain may be impacted. Temperatures above 3000 feet in elevation will remain near freezing until early afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while driving. Also be careful if venturing outside. Sidewalks, decks, and parking lots could be slick. Please report snow, sleet or ice accumulations via email at rnk.skywarn@noaa.gov or by calling the National Weather Service toll free at...1...866...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Leave a message with your observation and the specific location where it occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
